==Events==
* [[537]] &ndash; [[Siege of Rome (537–538)|Siege of Rome]]: The [[Ostrogoths|Ostrogoth]] army under king [[Vitiges]] began the [[siege]] of the capital. [[Belisarius]] conducts a delaying action outside the [[Piazza del Popolo|Flaminian Gate]]; he and a detachment of his ''[[Bucellarius|bucellarii]]'' are almost cut off.
* [[986]] &ndash; [[Louis V of France|Louis V]] becomes King of the [[Franks]].
*[[1121]] &ndash; [[Dirk VI, Count of Holland|Dirk VI]] becomes the [[Count of Holland]].
*[[1127]] &ndash; [[Assassination]] of [[Charles I, Count of Flanders|Charles the Good]], [[Count]] of [[Flanders]].
*[[1444]] &ndash; [[Skanderbeg]] organizes a group of [[Albanian people|Albanian]] nobles to form the [[League of Lezhë]].
*[[1458]] &ndash; [[George of Poděbrady]] is chosen as the [[King of Bohemia]].
*[[1476]] &ndash; [[Burgundian Wars]]: The [[Old Swiss Confederacy]] hands [[Charles the Bold]], [[Duchy of Burgundy|Duke of Burgundy]], a major defeat in the [[Battle of Grandson]] in [[Canton of Neuchâtel]].
*[[1484]] &ndash; The [[College of Arms]] is formally incorporated by [[Royal Charter]] signed by King [[Richard III of England]].
*[[1498]] &ndash; [[Vasco da Gama]]'s fleet visits the [[Island of Mozambique]].
*[[1561]] &ndash; [[Mendoza, Argentina]] is founded by Spanish conquistador [[Pedro del Castillo]].
*[[1657]] &ndash; [[Great Fire of Meireki]]: A fire in Edo (now Tokyo), Japan, caused more than 100,000 deaths; it lasted three days
*[[1717]] &ndash; ''[[The Loves of Mars and Venus]]'' is the first [[ballet]] performed in England.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Patriot (American Revolution)|Patriot]] militia units arrest the Royal Governor of [[Province of Georgia|Georgia]] [[James Wright (governor)|James Wright]] and attempt to prevent capture of supply ships in the [[Battle of the Rice Boats]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; Long-distance communication speeds up with the unveiling of a [[semaphore line|semaphore]] machine in [[Paris]].
*[[1797]] &ndash; The [[Bank of England]] [[Bank of England note issues|issues]] the first [[Banknotes of the pound sterling|one-pound]] and [[Banknotes of the pound sterling|two-pound]] [[banknote]]s.
*[[1807]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] passes the [[Act Prohibiting Importation of Slaves]], disallowing the [[import]]ation of new [[slavery|slaves]] into the country.
*[[1808]] &ndash; The inaugural meeting of the [[Wernerian Natural History Society]], a former Scottish [[learned society]], is held in [[Edinburgh]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Argentine War of Independence]]: A [[Spanish Empire|royalist]] fleet defeats a small [[flotilla]] of [[May Revolution|revolutionary]] ships in the [[Battle of San Nicolás]] on the [[Río de la Plata|River Plate]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; Signing of the [[Kandyan Convention]] treaty by [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|British]] invaders and the [[List of Sri Lankan monarchs|King of Sri Lanka]].
*[[1825]] &ndash; [[Roberto Cofresí]], one of the last successful [[Caribbean]] [[pirate]]s, is [[Action of 2 March 1825|defeated in combat]] and captured by authorities.
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Texas Revolution]]: [[Texas Declaration of Independence|Declaration of independence]] of the [[Republic of Texas]] from Mexico.
*[[1855]] &ndash; [[Alexander II of Russia|Alexander II]] becomes [[Tsar]] of Russia.
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[East Cape War]]: The [[Volkner Incident]] in New Zealand.
*[[1867]] &ndash; The U.S. Congress passes the first [[Reconstruction Act]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[U.S. presidential election, 1876]]: Just two days before inauguration, the U.S. Congress declares [[Rutherford B. Hayes]] the winner of the election even though [[Samuel J. Tilden]] had won the popular vote on November 7, 1876.
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Queen Victoria]] narrowly escapes an assassination attempt by [[Roderick McLean]] in Windsor.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Sino-French War]]: French victory in the [[Battle of Hòa Mộc|Battle of Hoa Moc]] near [[Tuyen Quang]], northern [[Vietnam]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; The U.S. Congress passes the [[Platt Amendment]] limiting the autonomy of [[Cuba]], as a condition of the withdrawal of American troops.
*[[1903]] &ndash; In New York City the [[Martha Washington Hotel]] opens, becoming the first [[hotel]] exclusively for [[women]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The enactment of the [[Jones-Shafroth Act]] grants [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Ricans]] United States citizenship.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The first [[Communist International]] meets in Moscow.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The film ''[[King Kong (1933 film)|King Kong]]'' opens at New York's [[Radio City Music Hall]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[Steel Workers Organizing Committee]] signs a [[collective bargaining]] agreement with [[U.S. Steel]], leading to unionization of the United States [[steel]] industry.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinal]] [[Eugenio Pacelli]] is [[Papal conclave, 1939|elected]] [[Pope]] and takes the name [[Pope Pius XII|Pius XII]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: First German military units enter Bulgaria [[Military history of Bulgaria during World War II|after it joins the Axis Pact]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Battle of the Bismarck Sea]] &ndash; United States and Australian forces sink Japanese convoy ships.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Ho Chi Minh]] is elected the President of [[North Vietnam]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Captain (U.S. Air Force)|Captain]] James Gallagher lands his [[B-50 Superfortress]] ''[[Lucky Lady II]]'' in [[Fort Worth, Texas]] after completing the first non-stop around-the-world [[airplane]] flight in 94 hours and one minute.
*  1949   &ndash; The first automatic [[street light]] is installed in [[New Milford, Connecticut]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Ruler of Cambodia|King]] [[Norodom Sihanouk]] of [[Cambodia]] abdicates the throne in favor of his father, King [[Norodom Suramarit]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Morocco]] gains its independence from [[France]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; In [[Burma]], the army led by General [[Ne Win]] seizes power in a ''[[1962 Burmese coup d'état|coup d'état]]''.
*  1962   &ndash; [[Wilt Chamberlain]] sets the single-game scoring [[NBA regular season records|record]] in the [[National Basketball Association]] by [[Wilt Chamberlain's 100-point game|scoring 100 points]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[United States Air Force|US]] and [[Vietnam Air Force|South Vietnamese Air Force]] begin [[Operation Rolling Thunder]], a sustained bombing campaign against [[North Vietnam]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; In [[Toulouse]], France, the first test flight of the Anglo-French [[Concorde]] is conducted.
*  1969   &ndash; [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] and Chinese forces clash at a border outpost on the [[Ussuri River]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Rhodesia]] declares itself a [[republic]], breaking its last links with the British crown.
*[[1972]] &ndash; The [[Pioneer 10]] space probe is launched from [[Cape Canaveral]], [[Florida]] with a mission to explore the outer [[planet]]s.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Czechoslovakia|Czech]] [[Vladimír Remek]] becomes the first non-[[Russian (citizen)|Russian]] or non-American to go into [[outer space|space]], when he is launched aboard [[Soyuz 28]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Compact Disc]]s and players are released for the first time in the United States and other markets. They had previously been available only in [[Japan]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; Twelve [[European Community]] nations agree to ban the production of all [[chlorofluorocarbon]]s (CFCs) by the end of the century.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Nelson Mandela]] is elected deputy President of the [[African National Congress]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; Battle at [[Rumaila field|Rumaila Oil Field]] brings an end to the [[Gulf War|1991 Gulf War]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Armenia]], [[Azerbaijan]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Kyrgyzstan]], [[Moldova]], [[San Marino]], [[Tajikistan]], [[Turkmenistan]] and [[Uzbekistan]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; Researchers at [[Fermilab]] announce the discovery of the [[top quark]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; Data sent from the [[Galileo spacecraft]] indicates that [[Jupiter]]'s moon [[Europa (moon)|Europa]] has a liquid ocean under a thick crust of ice.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|U.S. invasion of Afghanistan]]: [[Operation Anaconda]] begins, (ending on [[March 19]] after killing 500 [[Taliban]] and [[al Qaeda]] fighters, with 11 Western troop fatalities).
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[2003 invasion of Iraq|War in Iraq]]: [[Al-Qaeda]] carries out the [[Ashoura Massacre]] in [[Iraq]], killing 170 and wounding over 500.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[March 2–3, 2012 tornado outbreak|tornado outbreak]] occurred over a large section of the Southern [[United States]] and into the [[Ohio Valley]] region, resulting in 40 tornado-related fatalities.
